ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Brainstem Ganglioglioma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: MRI revealed a cystic mass in the right medulla; tissue biopsy confirmed ganglioglioma.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Brainstem Glioma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial MRI findings implicated a brainstem glioma before specific histological confirmation.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Initial assessment of headaches, dizziness, and coordination issues.
To investigate suspected central pathology given neurological signs.
Evaluate vestibular function given dizziness and nystagmus.
Assess integrity of auditory brainstem pathways given brainstem signs.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presented with progressive neurological symptoms including headaches, ataxia, and dysphagia. Physical exam revealed nystagmus and dysmetria. MRI identified a cystic brainstem mass in the medulla, distorting the fourth ventricle.

tests.name: Physical/Neurological Exam
tests.result_summary: Lateral and rotary nystagmus toward the right; minimal dysmetria on finger-to-nose testing on the right.

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Abnormal cystic mass in the brainstem principally involving the right side of the medulla with distortion of the left inferior portion of the fourth ventricle.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation revealed normal peripheral hearing despite subjective complaints. ENG confirmed central vestibular dysfunction with spontaneous and down-beating nystagmus. ABR was borderline normal, suggesting the lesion in the rostral medulla spared the primary auditory tracts.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Hearing sensitivity within normal limits for both ears (10-15 dB HL); no significant asymmetry.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition scores excellent bilaterally (92% AU).

tests.name: Electronystagmography (ENG)
tests.result_summary: Significant spontaneous right-beating nystagmus; down-beating nystagmus present; abnormal smooth pursuit. Caloric testing refused.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Normal absolute latencies; borderline normal interwave intervals (I-III, I-V). Waveform morphology good.

counseling_actions: Explain that 'muffled' hearing is likely central/neurological given normal audiogram
Discuss correlation between dizziness and ENG findings (nystagmus)
Review MRI findings and necessity of immediate medical management
Discuss significance of family history of brainstem tumor

escalation.rationale_short: Confirmed brainstem mass requires biopsy and radiation therapy.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor response to radiation therapy and neurological status.

expected_outcome: Diagnosis confirmed as ganglioglioma by tissue biopsy.
Patient is being followed by a staff neurologist.
